p: The experimental procedure is HA-SIB-WBRT. 40-45Gy in 10 fractions will be used for the SIB boost depending on the location of the lesion. 45Gy was selected as it has a similar biological effective dose (BED 65.2Gy; α/β = 10) to the 21Gy SRS dose. 40Gy (EQD2 60Gy; α/β = 2) was selected for tumours within/ close to organs at risk (OARs) to meet the recommended dose limits of common OARs. Any post-operative cavity will be contoured using consensus guidelines [ 18]. The cavity will be given a boost of 40Gy due to the high risk of microscopic residual disease and tumour seeding. Any gross residual tumour should be boosted to 45Gy. Further radiotherapy dose guidance is described in Table 2.
